titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2210) to reauthorize the Head Start Act to improve the school readiness of disadvantaged children, and for other purposes.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 96.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-232, by Ms. Pryce (OH).
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2210.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 336.

POSTPONED ROLL CALL VOTE - The Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Hastings (FL) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the previous question until later in the legislative day.

VACATING ORDER FOR YEAS AND NAYS - By unanimous consent, the previous order for the Yeas and Nays on the question of ordering the previous question on H. Res. 336 was vacated and the disposition of the question reverted to the voice vote taken earlier on which the ayes had prevailed, and the previous question was ordered.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/24/2003--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2210 (School Readiness Act of 2003).
